intro: Phaca serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer to autumn, producing vibrant pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Phaca serotina is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
